title: For NATO, Trump threat adds to challenge of war in Ukraine
summary: As the military alliance prepares to celebrate its 75th anniversary, the former American president's recent statements have shaken an organization charged with ensuring collective security from Russia while there is an ongoing war at its borders.

title: Ukraine's allies divided over potential ground intervention raised by Macron
summary: The French president said 'no option should be discarded' to bolster military support for Kyiv at a conference attended by leaders of Ukraine's allies, but recognized there was 'no consensus.'

title: Islamophobia among UK's Tories put under the spotlight by Gaza war
summary: Pro-Palestinian demonstrations in London have brought out Islamophobic responses from Conservative leaders, who are weakened by the rise of the far right.

title: Biden says government shutdown would 'significantly' damage US economy amid high-stakes talks
summary: The US president convened the top four leaders of the US House and Senate to the White House on Tuesday as the threat of a government shutdown looms.

title: Torture routine in the prison where Alexei Navalny died
summary: According to inmate statements gathered by independent Russian media, violence and mistreatment are common in the Arctic penal colony where the Kremlin opponent died.

title: 2024 Olympics: North Korea women's football team, long a propaganda tool, hopes to qualify
summary: The North Korean women's team, which has been one of the regime's showcases for almost 30 years, will secure its spot for Paris 2024 if it beats Japan on Wednesday.

title: Donald Trump, sentenced to secure half a billion dollars by the end of March
summary: Facing hundreds of millions of dollars in damages in two separate cases, the former president appears poised to leverage the IPO of his social media platform, Truth Social, as a strategic maneuver to evade bankruptcy.

title: Two men convicted of killing Run-DMC's Jam Master Jay, nearly 22 years after hip-hop star's death
summary: Ronald Washington and Karl Jordan Jr., the alleged shooter, were found guilty on all counts by a US federal jury on February 27, and convicted of firearms-related murder while engaged in narcotics trafficking.

title: Brazil's Jair Bolsonaro under investigation for allegedly harassing a humpback whale
summary: Legal experts say that if Sao Paulo's federal police can prove that the former president intentionally approached the whale, he risks a 2,500 reais (just over $500) fine at most.

title: How Notre-Dame Cathedral's wooden framework was rebuilt identically
summary: Achieving the feat required architects to draw on archaeological, physical and digital data compiled in record time by numerous scientific teams.

title: Mali: 31 dead after bus plunges off bridge
summary: "The likely cause is the driver losing control of the vehicle," the Malian Ministry of Transport said in a statement.

title: Police find 72 guns at French film star Alain Delon's home
summary: The 88-year-old actor, who doesn't have a permit for any of the firearms, has been in poor health since he suffered a stroke in 2019 and has recently been the center of an escalating family feud.

title: Across the US, pro-Palestinian activism is gaining ground
summary: With demonstrations in front of public buildings and the homes of elected officials and dozens of cities voting for ceasefire resolutions, efforts to denounce the Biden administration's complicity in the ongoing killing in Gaza are growing.

title: 'Dune Part Two': The making of a messiah
summary: Denis Villeneuve has delivered a literal, plot-driven adaptation of Frank Herbert's best-selling novel.

title: Palestinian prime minister's resignation paves way for technocratic government
summary: Washington is pushing the Ramallah-based government, which is very unpopular with the Palestinians, to undertake reforms to prepare for after the Gaza war.

title: France-Morocco relations: Paris hints at a change in position on Western Sahara
summary: On a short visit to Rabat, the French foreign minister recognized the 'existential' dimension of the Saharan territory for Morocco, without endorsing Morocco's claim to sovereignty.

title: Macron hosts emir of Qatar, who is at the heart of Gaza truce talks
summary: Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani is making his first state visit to Paris since acceding to the throne in 2013.

title: Microsoft deal with French startup Mistral AI comes under EU scrutiny
summary: The European Commission said it would analyze Microsoft's €15 million investment in Mistral AI announced the day before.

title: France bans 'steak' label on vegetarian products
summary: The government's decree is a response to a long-standing complaint by the meat industry that terms like 'vegetarian ham' or 'vegan sausage' were confusing for consumers.

title: France's changing climate: Fewer cold temperature records are being set
summary: In France, only one month since February 2022 has registered temperatures below seasonal norms. On a more global scale, extreme cold spells, which are still possible but less likely, are in sharp decline.

title: 'The sea, a place without borders, is under threat from geopolitical fragmentation'
summary: From the Bab al-Mandab Strait, under fire from the Houthi rebels, to the Black Sea, the China Sea and the North Sea, international waters will play a key role in the new global geopolitics, according to columnist Julien Bouissou.

title: 'I lost everything in one single night: my home, my homeland, my freedom'
summary: 'First Times': Pivotal moments during the transition to adulthood. This week, Behishta, 25,  shares her harrowing journey fleeing Afghanistan following the Taliban's seizure of power in August 2021. She also discusses her academic pursuits in France, where she is currently studying at HEC.

title: Biden and Trump secure victories in Michigan primaries, nearing potential rematch
summary: In the Democratic primary, Biden clinched a decisive victory over Minnesota Representative Dean Phillips, his lone substantial rival. Meanwhile, Trump's dominance continues unabated as he secures triumphs across the initial five states on the Republican primary schedule.

title: Geneva Motor Show 2024: Luca de Meo defends an "Airbus for small electric cars".
summary: To facilitate the climate transition and reduce the price of electric vehicles, Renault's CEO emphasizes the necessity of alliances among manufacturers and supports a regulatory overhaul within the European Union.

title: Great apes may playfully tease each other, but they do not joke around
summary: An international team of cognitive biologists and primatologists has identified 18 distinct teasing behaviors in the great apes they studied.

title: Nuclear weapons facility pauses operations as wildfires spread through rural Texas
summary: In a dramatic turn of events, the sprawling nuclear weapons facility nestled in the heart of the rural Panhandle of Texas has been forced to suspend its operations on Tuesday, February 27, as wildfires rage through the region.

title: Biden wins Democratic primary in Michigan, despite a protest 'uncommitted' vote over Gaza
summary: The president easily topped the poll in this state with a large Arab American and Muslim community, but tens of thousands of supporters abstained or voted 'uncommitted' to protest against the White House's unwavering support for Israel.

title: Where to travel in 2024: Le Monde's top 10 destinations in France and Europe
summary: This year, Le Monde takes you pedaling between the volcanoes of Auvergne, walking on the breathtaking Aletsch Glacier, strolling in Zaragoza and cycling among volcanic sleeping beauties.

title: Macron defends idea of potentially sending troops to Ukraine as allies distance themselves
summary: The French presidency said Tuesday that the question had been raised during calls with other Western leaders ahead of the Paris conference where Macron said 'no option should be ruled out.'

title: End lifetime driving licenses
summary: Lifetime licensing was introduced at a time when older drivers were a tiny minority. Although life expectancy in good health is increasing, the aging European population means that legislation must be adapted to this demographic upheaval.

title: No window, six in a room: Abusive landlords' schemes near the France-Luxembourg border
summary: Workers from various countries, attracted by Luxembourg's salaries, are offered tiny apartments on the French side of the border, where rents are significantly cheaper. Elected officials are at a loss on how to crack down on the abusive landlords.

title: From Niger to Guinea, ECOWAS sanctions against juntas have failed
summary: Amid the biggest crisis in its history, the West African regional organization is now prioritizing dialogue in an attempt to keep military-led countries within its fold – at the risk of losing credibility.

title: 'On all fronts, Biden risks paying a high price for his choices in the current Middle East crisis'
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu's total opposition to the prospect of a Palestinian state is not good news for the Democratic president, who can't hope to be re-elected without winning states like Michigan in November, with its large community sympathetic to the plight of the Palestinians in Gaza.

title: Frontex did not issue Mayday call ahead of Greece shipwreck in which 650 migrants died
summary: A report by European Ombudsman Emily O'Reilly examines the EU border agency's shortcomings during the disaster in June 2023. She criticizes its lack of cooperation with Greece and floats the idea of suspending its activities in certain cases.

title: Navalny's funeral to be held in Moscow on Friday
summary: The Russian opposition leader died on February 17 in the secrecy and isolation of an Arctic prison.

title: Three wealthy white men and their battle against diversity in US business and academia
summary: Three influential figures – Edward Blum, Bill Ackman, and Elon Musk – have made it their mission to fight programs designed to promote the inclusion of women and minorities.

title: French PM suggests 'Putin's troops are already in our country,' pointing at Le Pen
summary: Heated exchanges broke out in Parliament between Prime Minister Gabriel Attal and far-right leader Marine Le Pen, following Emmanuel Macron's statement that sending Western troops to Ukraine should 'not be ruled out.'

title: French Sénat set to vote on making abortion a constitutional 'freedom'
summary: The conservative-dominated chamber's approval is needed for a joint session of Parliament to be held to change the Constitution.

title: Why a ground offensive in Rafah would be devastating
summary: The town's population has increased fivefold with the arrival of over a million Gazans displaced by the war. The city is also in the sights of the Israeli army, which considers it to be Hamas' last stronghold.

title: Northern Ireland: Court rules amnesty law on Troubles 'in breach' of human rights
summary: A court in Belfast ruled the law granting immunity to combatants was not compatible with the European Convention on Human Rights.

title: French far-right leader makes surprise U-turn on minimum prices for farmers
summary: At the Paris Agricultural Show, Jordan Bardella, the chair of the far-right Rassemblement National party, called minimum prices a 'poverty trap' – though his party has defended them for a decade.

title: French gas consumption falls as imports from Russia continue
summary: Consumer and industrial demand has dropped in 2023. Although Russian energy imports have fallen dramatically, deliveries continue, mainly by ship.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Investigation opened after engineer loses USB containing Paris traffic plans
summary: An engineer employed by Paris City Hall reported to police that he had misplaced his bag at Paris' Gare du Nord train station. According to prosecutors, the key contained no sensitive security information.

title: Narges Mohammadi: In Iran, 'women lead the strongest civil disobedience actions'
summary: The Iranian Nobel Peace Prize winner answered Le Monde's questions on women's rights in Iran today, from Evin prison, near Tehran.

title: Women's Nations League: France chases first title against world champions Spain
summary: The French women's football team is looking to earn their first-ever trophy ahead of the home Olympic Games in August.

title: Israeli soldiers deployed in Gaza post their abuses on social media
summary: The service members operating in the Palestinian enclave brag about their exploits on TikTok or Instagram. The stream of videos showing humiliations, looting and destruction attest to the sense of impunity that drives them.

title: UN warns of dire effects of rising global waste creation
summary: The UN Environment Programme said the world generated 2.3 billion tons of municipal waste last year.

title: Detained French journalist overstepped accreditation, says Ethiopian government
summary: Antoine Galindo, who has been detained since February 22, had traveled to Ethiopia to cover the African Union summit earlier this month for the specialist publication Africa Intelligence.

title: French prosecutors widen rape probe on former star news anchor 'PPDA'
summary: The rape investigation against Patrick Poivre d'Arvor, following his indictment in December 2023, was widened to include 3 more cases of rape or sexual assault, out of 23 other testimonies of women who have accused him of sexual abuse or harassement.

title: US regulators give Boeing 90 days to provide quality control plan
summary: Boeing has suffered setback after setback after several security and quality control incidents since an air panel blew off mid-flight on an Alaska Airlines flight in January. The company's shares have plummeted, and it has been under intense official scrutiny.

title: French Sénat approves bill to make abortion a constitutional 'freedom'
summary: The conservative-dominated Sénat, with 267 votes to 50, approved the bill to constitutionalize abortion as a 'guaranteed freedom.' President Emmanuel Macron will call a joint session of Parliament on March 4 for a final vote on the reform.

title: US Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell to step down in November
summary: McConnell, 82, has been the longest-serving Senate Republican leader in American history. In his tenure, he battled Obama's policies from 2015, supported Trump in 2017 – only to fall out with him in 2020 – and was an outspoken supporter of US aid to Ukraine.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: What's planned for athletes' children
summary: Several female participants asked to be allowed to keep their babies close to them during the Games. The French Olympic and Paralympic committees clarified the measures they are putting in place.

title: Women's Nations League: World champions Spain beat France 2-0
summary: Two goals by Spain's Aitana Bonmati and Mariona Caldentey clinched the trophy for the World Champions in Sevilla.

title: Hop away? Paris deals with unwelcome rabbits at Les Invalides
summary: The animal protection association Paris Animaux Zoopolis is concerned by the police's decision to remove the European rabbits that have taken up residence on the monument's lawns and are accused of contributing to soil collapse.

title: Ghana's parliament passes anti-LGBTQ+ rights bill
summary: The controversial bill, which would impose 3-to-5 year jail terms for people advocating for LGBTQ+ rights. Proposed by the opposition, it still has to be validated by President Nana Akufo-Addo, who has previously spoken out against gay marriage.

title: Acclaimed actor Richard Lewis dies at 76
summary: With his trademark black attire and unruly shock of hair, Lewis brought a unique blend of self-deprecation and existential angst to the comedy stage.

title: Supreme Court, moving swiftly, agrees to hear Trump's presidential immunity appeal
summary: Donald Trump is the first prominent presidential candidate in US history to pursue reelection amidst a whirlwind of numerous civil, criminal, and legal inquiries and court proceedings. America's highest court scheduled oral arguments in the high-stakes case for the week of April 22.

title: US lawmakers reach tentative deal, averting government shutdown
summary: The US Congress approved temporary funding measures on Wednesday, safeguarding the operations of several crucial federal agencies and preventing the potential furlough of thousands of employees.
